snippet: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo and his running mate, Kathy Hochul, captured the Democratic primary over two law school professors, Zephyr Teachout and Tim Wu.
abstract: New York Gov Andrew Cuomo claims Democratic nomination for second term; Cuomo's opponent Zephyr Teachout is on track to receive about a third of the vote, signal of potent dissatisfaction with Cuomo in his party's left wing; Cuomo's choice for lieutenant governor, Kathy Hochul, soundly defeats Teachout's running mate Tim Wu.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Susanne Craig, Matt Flegenheimer, Kate Pastor and Nate Schweber from New York, Joseph Berger from New Castle and Sara DiNatale from Buffalo. Alain Delaquérière contributed research.

lead_paragraph: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo and his running mate, Kathy Hochul, captured the Democratic primary over two law school professors, Zephyr Teachout and Tim Wu.

headline.main: Cuomo Defeats Teachout, Liberal Rival, in the Democratic Primary
headline.print_headline: Cuomo Defeats a Liberal Rival in the Primary
